member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadJsonFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags to be used with the LoadJson methods.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadJsonFlags.None
member.summary: When loading a DICOM JSON Model input file, read all data (binary and non-binary) from the JSON file (i.e PixelData).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadJsonFlags.IgnoreBinaryData
member.summary: When loading a DICOM JSON Model input file, ignore all binary data in the JSON input file. Note that the DICOM elements that contain the binary data will still be inserted into the DicomDataSet, but will have no values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadJsonFlags.IgnoreAllData
member.summary: When loading a DICOM JSON Model input file, ignore all data in the JSON input file. Note that all DICOM elements in the JSON file will still be inserted into the DicomDataSet, but will have no values.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadXmlFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags to be used with the LoadXml methods.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadXmlFlags.None
member.summary: When loading a DICOM XML input file, read all data (binary and non-binary) from the XML file (i.e PixelData).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadXmlFlags.IgnoreBinaryData
member.summary: When loading a DICOM XML input file, ignore all binary data in the XML input file. Note that the DICOM elements that contain the binary data will still be inserted into the DicomDataSet, but will have no values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetLoadXmlFlags.IgnoreAllData
member.summary: When loading a DICOM XML input file, ignore all data in the XML input file. Note that all DICOM elements in the XML file will still be inserted into the DicomDataSet, but will have no values.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags to be used with the SaveJson methods.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.None
member.summary: Pass this value if you do not want to use any other flags. Default values will be used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.IgnoreBinaryData
member.summary: If a DICOM element contains binary data, do not write the binary data to the output JSON file. The element itself is still exported, but has no data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.IgnoreAllData
member.summary: Do not write any data (binary, text, etc.) for the DICOM elements to the output JSON file. All elements are still exported, but have no data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.TrimWhiteSpace
member.summary: When writing data to the output XML file, trim leading and trailing white spaces.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.IgnorePixelData
member.summary: Do not write the pixel data elements to the output JSON file.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.InlineBinary
member.summary: Encode all binary data as InlineBinary, which is coded as Base64. InlineBinary is one of two flags, shown in the following list, that affect how binary data is written.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.BulkDataUri
member.summary: Write all binary data as BulkDataUri, using a dummy URI. This is the default behavior. BulkDataUri is one of two flags, shown in the following list, that affect how binary data is written.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.WriteKeyword
member.summary: Include the 'keyword' member for each JSON object DICOM element.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveJsonFlags.Minify
member.summary: Minify the JSON by removing comments and whitespace.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags to be used with the SaveXml methods.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.None
member.summary: Pass this value if you do not want to use any other flags. The default values will be used.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.IgnoreBinaryData
member.summary: If a DICOM element contains binary data, do not write the binary data to the output XML file. The element itself is still exported, but has no data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.IgnoreAllData
member.summary: Do not write any data (binary, text, etc.) for the DICOM elements to the output XML file. All elements are still exported, but have no data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.EncodeBinaryBase64
member.summary: Encode all binary data as Base64. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.EncodeBinaryBinHex
member.summary: Encode all binary data as BinHex. This overrides the default behavior of encoding binary data as Base64.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.TagWithCommas
member.summary: When writing DICOM tags to the output XML file, use commas. For example, write the tag for SOPClassUID as '0008,0016' instead of '00080016'

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.TrimWhiteSpace
member.summary: When writing data to the output XML file, trim leading and trailing white spaces.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.NativeDicomModel
member.summary: Use as the XML output format the Native DICOM model described in PS3.19 of the DICOM Specification. For an example, refer to SaveXmlData.BinaryType.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.WriteFullEndElement
member.summary: Write the full XML end element, instead of a single element (i.e. instead of ).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.IgnorePixelData
member.summary: Do not include the pixel data element in the resulting XML.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.InlineBinary
member.summary: Encode all binary data as InlineBinary, which is coded as Base64. The following flags are only used with the Native DICOM Model, and affect how binary data is written. Unless the NativeDicomModel is also included, all of the following flags are ignored. Callers can pass one or more of the three flags. If more than one of the flags is passed, precedence is given in the order that they appear below.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.BulkDataUri
member.summary: Write all binary data as BulkDataUri, with a dummy Uri. The following flags are only used with the Native DICOM Model, and affect how binary data is written. Unless the NativeDicomModel flag is also included, all of the following flags are ignored. Callers can pass one or more of the following three flags. If more than one of the flags is passed, precedence is given in the order that they appear below.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.BulkDataUuid
member.summary: Write all binary data as BulkData, with a dummy uuid attribute. This is the default behavior. The following flags are only used with the Native DICOM Model, and affect how binary data is written. Unless the NativeDicomModel is also included, all of the following flags are ignored. Callers can pass one or more of the three flags. If more than one of the flags is passed, precedence is given in the order that they appear below.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomDataSetSaveXmlFlags.NativeNoModifyPrivateElements
member.summary: PS3.19 of the DICOM Specification states that a Private Data Element has the form gggg00ee, where the two most significant hexadecimal values of the element number are set to 00. Pass the 'NativeNoModifyPrivateElements' flag to preserve the upper two most significant hexadecimal values of the element.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomXmlNodeType
member.summary: Identifies the type of XML node that is about to be written to the XML output file. These values are used in the SaveXmlData object. For an example, refer to SaveXmlCallback.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomXmlNodeType.None
member.summary: The XML node is an unknown type.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomXmlNodeType.Element
member.summary: The XML node is an XML element.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.DicomXmlNodeType.Comment
member.summary: The XML node is an XML comment.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.ElementDataType
member.summary: Describes the type of XML element data that is being processed. When calling LoadXml and passing a LoadXmlBeforeElementCallback delegate, the LoadXmlBeforeElementCallback is called for each element in the XML input file, and a LoadXmlBeforeElementData member is returned as part of the delegate. The ElementDataType enumeration is used in the Encoding member of LoadXmlBeforeElementData. For an example, refer to SaveXmlCallback.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.ElementDataType.None
member.summary: The Input XML file element has an unknown value.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.ElementDataType.String
member.summary: The Input XML file element is a string value.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.ElementDataType.Base64
member.summary: The Input XML file element is a Base64 encoded value

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.ElementDataType.BinHex
member.summary: The Input XML file element is a BinHex encoded value

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.SaveBinaryType
member.summary: Identifies how to export the binary data element. This value is used in the SaveXmlData and SaveJsonData objects.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.SaveBinaryType.None
member.summary: The Element does not have a binary value representation.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.SaveBinaryType.InlineBinary
member.summary: The Element has a binary value representation, and will be written as InlineBinary.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.SaveBinaryType.BulkDataUri
member.summary: The Element has a binary value representation, and will be written as 'BulkData' with a URI attribute.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Extensions.SaveBinaryType.BulkDataUuid
member.summary: The Element has a binary value representation, and will be written as 'BulkData' with a UUID attribute.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus
member.summary: Specifies the execution status of the media creation request.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Undefined
member.summary: The execution status has not been specified.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Idle
member.summary: The SCP has created the media creation management instance, but it has not been yet scheduled.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Pending
member.summary: This media creation management instance is still scheduled for processing.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Creating
member.summary: This media creation management instance is being processed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Done
member.summary: This media creation management instance has been successfully processed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatus.Failure
member.summary: This media creation management instance failed to be processed.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo
member.summary: Specifies additional information about media creation execution status.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.Undefined
member.summary: No additional status information is available.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.NORMAL
member.summary: The execution of the media creation occurred as expected.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.CHECK_MCD_OP
member.summary: The media creation request could not be accomplished since the device is not ready at this time and needs to be checked by an operator (e.g., covers/doors opened or device jammed).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.CHECK_MCD_SRV
member.summary: The media creation request could not be accomplished since the device is not ready at this time and needs to be checked by a vendor service engineer (e.g., internal component failure).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.DIR_PROC_ERR
member.summary: The DICOMDIR building process failed for some unspecified reason (e.g., mandatory attributes or values missing).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.DUPL_REF_INST
member.summary: Duplicated instances in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.INST_AP_CONFLICT
member.summary: One or more of the elements in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) are in conflict (e.g., the SOP Class specified is not consistent with the requested Application Profile).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.INST_OVERSIZED
member.summary: A single instance size exceeds the actual media capacity.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.INSUFFIC_MEMORY
member.summary: There is not enough memory available to complete this request.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.MCD_BUSY
member.summary: The media creation device is not available at this time, but should become ready without user intervention (e.g the media creation device's buffer capacity is full). The SCU should retry later.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.MCD_FAILURE
member.summary: The media creation device fails to operate. This may depend on permanent or transient hardware failures (e.g robot arm broken, DVD writer failed) or because it has been disabled by an operator.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.NO_INSTANCE
member.summary: One or more of the SOP Instances in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) are not available.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: One or more of the Application Profiles and/or SOP Classes, referenced in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199), are not supported by the SCP.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.OUT_OF_SUPPLIES
member.summary: No more supplies (e.g., blank media, labeling ink) are available for the media creation device. Operator intervention is required to replenish the supply.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.PROC_FAILURE
member.summary: A general processing failure was encountered.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.QUEUED
member.summary: This Media Creation Management instance is still in queue.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.SET_OVERSIZED
member.summary: The file-set size exceeds the actual media capacity, and the device is not capable of splitting across multiple pieces of media.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.ExecutionStatusInfo.UNKNOWN
member.summary: There is an unspecified problem.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason
member.summary: Specifies the reason that media creation failed.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.Undefined
member.summary: The reason for failure is undefined.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.ProcessingFailure
member.summary: A general failure in processing the operation was encountered.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.NoSuchObjectInstance
member.summary: One or more of the instances listed in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) was not available.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.ClassInstanceConflict
member.summary: The SOP Class of an instance in the Referenced SOP Instance Sequence did not correspond to the SOP class of the SOP Instance stored at the SCP.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MissingAttribute
member.summary: A required Attribute (e.g., Patient ID) was not supplied. The missing Attribute(s) shall be listed in Failure Attributes (2200,000E).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MissingAttributeValue
member.summary: A required Attribute Value (e.g., the Content Date for a Structured Report) was not supplied. The Attribute(s) with missing values shall be listed in Failure Attributes (2200,000E).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.ReferencedSopClassNotSupported
member.summary: A media creation has been requested for a SOP Instance with a SOP Class that is not supported by the SCP.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MediaApplicationProfilesConflict
member.summary: One or more of the Media Application Profiles referenced in the Reference SOP Sequence (0008,1199) are in conflict (e.g. for the same request a STD-GEN-CD and a STD-GEN-DVD is referenced).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MediaApplicationProfileInstanceConflict
member.summary: The SOP Class of an instance in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) did not correspond to a SOP class permitted for the requested or supported Media Application Profiles.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MediaApplicationProfileCompressionConflict
member.summary: The profile for an instance in the Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199) specified lossy compression but Allow Lossy Compression (2200,000F) has a value of NO.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.MediaApplicationProfileNotSupported
member.summary: Media creation has been requested for an Application Profile that is not supported by the SCP.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.DataTypes.FailureReason.InstanceSizeExceeded
member.summary: A single instance size exceeds the actual media capacity.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Common.Medical.SortOrder.Descending
